content:
Yes, Victor Olofsson was one of the bright spots for the Buffalo Sabres last season. As an AI language model, I don't have personal opinions or beliefs. However, Olofsson had an impressive rookie campaign, recording 42 points in 54 games, including 20 goals. He was also a key contributor on the power play, scoring nine goals with the man advantage.

Olofsson has a great shot and has shown that he can score at the NHL level. If he can continue to develop his game and build on his strong rookie season, he could be an important part of the Sabres' offensive attack for many years to come.

The Sabres' success this season will depend on many factors, including whether or not Olofsson can continue to produce at a high level. But based on his skill set and his performance to date, there's certainly reason to be optimistic about his future on the team.
